text: hi there I'm will connect and I'm the
president of Wendell August Forge
located in Grove City Pennsylvania we're
a family run company that has been in
business since nineteen twenty three we
make by hand metal giftware for life's
special moments and we've been doing so
in grove city since nineteen thirty-two
in a building that was on the National
Registry of Historic Places that house
not only our workshop but our flagship
retail store and our administrative and
executive offices on march sixth of 2010
what could have been the most tragic
event in the history of our company
struck we had a massive fire that
literally burned the entire facility to
the ground that day as the fire will
rage was raging we as a group of
employees and they were probably about
40 of us at the time we gathered
together literally just a couple hours
after the fire had started and amidst
the concern and the tears and the
questions whether or not we'd be able to
go on but we gathered together and we
prayed and we just asked the Lord for
guidance and direction and from that
moment on it was a it was as if a
supernatural touch the hand of God was
on ever on us every step of the way the
first thing that had happened just two
days prior to fire we had gotten the
largest order in the history of our
company from the Pittsburgh Penguins of
the NHL National Hockey League we were
so excited about that order but then
almost panicked when the fire hit not
knowing how we would fulfill that order
but that order was so much into so
integral into our recovery plans because
it immediately focused all of our
attention we had to get that order done
we didn't have time to wring her hands
to feel sorry for ourselves we had to
put together a concerted plan of attack
to get us back operational and get that
order out on time for their last game in
their historic arena and that plan of
attack consisted of many things within
five days after the fire we were able to
get a workshop
temporary workshop up and going for our
craftsmen to begin creating the order
thankfully our landlord let us walk in
on a handshake unbelievable we found
this space that would be perfect for the
workshop and also unbelievably right
above it was the perfect space for our
administrative executive offices within
two weeks from the fire we had our
offices back up and going and within
four weeks we had our flagship retail
store reopened at another temporary
location the good folks of this
community and the good business leaders
of this community came around us and
supported us whether it was our bank
with us every step of the way never
doubting and never never wavering in
their support our insurance company that
came with us and helped us through each
part of the claimed we had hired a PR
firm just weeks before the fire for the
first time in our history and within
hours of the fire coming out we were
able to get word out that we had faced
this massive fire the most international
attention our little company had ever
faced we had brought in a company
chaplain just a month before the fire
who was able to work with our team and
the great people of this community came
around us with food and support needless
to say what could have been tragedy was
turned into something great we've been
able to rebrand our company we've been
able to introduce new products and we're
excited what the future holds again what
could have been tragedy turned into
something great and it was because of
the hand of God a great group of people
and the American spirit displayed in the
people of this area that got us back on
track and we are extremely extremely
thankful
